{"name":"SCYC Event enquiry auto response","sendTo":{"type":"field","email":null,"field":"email","routing":[{"input_value":"","field":null,"operator":"=","value":null}]},"fromName":"","fromEmail":"","replyTo":"","bcc":"","subject":"SCYC Event Enquiry ","message":"

Dear {inputs.names.first_name}

Thank you for your enquiry. 

The information you have provided will enable me to make a recommendation to the SCYC Council (Board) on whether in principle the Club can host your event. Decisions on hosting events are taken by the SCYC Council as a whole (and not by me as Events Officer). The way the process works is that, following my recommendation, the SCYC Council makes a preliminary decision and - if favourable - discussions then continue to enable us to determine an appropriate hosting fee. This will require us to obtain additional information and the information will be captured in a document which will ultimately form the contract between SCYC and the Class Association. A contract will not be formed until all the additional information required is received, a hosting fee is agreed and the full proposal has been approved by the SCYC Council.

The Class Association should refrain from implying in any publicity materials that a contract to host the event exists until such time as the relevant documents have been signed by both the Class Association and SCYC.

Kind regards

Mark Thompson

SCYC Events Officer

Dear {inputs.names.first_name}

Thank you for your enquiry. 

The information you have provided will enable me to make a recommendation to the SCYC Council (Board) on whether in principle the Club can host your event. Decisions on hosting events are taken by the SCYC Council as a whole (and not by me as Events Officer). The way the process works is that, following my recommendation, the SCYC Council makes a preliminary decision and - if favourable - discussions then continue to enable us to determine an appropriate hosting fee. This will require us to obtain additional information and the information will be captured in a document which will ultimately form the contract between SCYC and the Class Association. A contract will not be formed until all the additional information required is received, a hosting fee is agreed and the full proposal has been approved by the SCYC Council.

The Class Association should refrain from implying in any publicity materials that a contract to host the event exists until such time as the relevant documents have been signed by both the Class Association and SCYC.

Kind regards

Mark Thompson

SCYC Events Officer
